org.xadisk.bridge.proxies.interfaces
Interface XAFileInputStream

public interface XAFileInputStream

Represents an input stream to a file. Such a stream can be opened through the createXAFileInputStream method.

This stream can be further wrapped by a utility class XAFileInputStreamWrapper to get easy pluggability via the standard InputStream.

Since:
1.0

Method Summary

          Returns the number of bytes (readily) available in the internal buffer of this stream.
 void close()
          Closes this stream.

          Tells whether this stream has been closed.

          Returns the current position (pointer) in the stream.

          Reads the next byte if available.

          Read at least 1 byte, upto b.length bytes from the stream and put them into the array b.
 int read(byte[] b, int off, int length)
          Read at least 1 byte, upto length bytes from the stream and put them into the array b starting at offset off.
 long skip(long n)
          Skips upto n bytes in the stream.

close

void close()
           throws NoTransactionAssociatedException
Closes this stream. After closing, this stream becomes invalid for any i/o operations.

Throws:
NoTransactionAssociatedException

read

         throws ClosedStreamException,
                NoTransactionAssociatedException
Reads the next byte if available. If EOF has been reached, returns -1.

Returns:

read

int read(byte[] b)
         throws ClosedStreamException,
                NoTransactionAssociatedException
Read at least 1 byte, upto b.length bytes from the stream and put them into the array b.

Parameters:
b - the byte array into which the bytes will be read.
Returns:
number of bytes actually read. -1 if EOF has been reached before reading even 1 byte.
Throws:
ClosedStreamException
NoTransactionAssociatedException

read

int read(byte[] b,
         int off,
         int length)
         throws ClosedStreamException,
                NoTransactionAssociatedException
Read at least 1 byte, upto length bytes from the stream and put them into the array b starting at offset off.

Parameters:
b - the byte array into which the bytes will be read.
off - offset in the byte array.
length - maximum number of bytes to read
Returns:
number of bytes actually read. -1 if EOF has been reached before reading even 1 byte.
Throws:
ClosedStreamException
NoTransactionAssociatedException

skip

long skip(long n)
          throws NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                 ClosedStreamException
Skips upto n bytes in the stream.

Parameters:
n - a non-negative integer representing the number of bytes to skip.
Returns:
actual number of bytes that were skipped.
Throws:
NoTransactionAssociatedException
ClosedStreamException

position

void position(long n)
              throws NoTransactionAssociatedException,
                     ClosedStreamException
Positions the pointer inside the stream from where the next bytes will be read.

Parameters:
n - the new position; should be within 0 and fileLength, both inclusive.
Throws:
NoTransactionAssociatedException
ClosedStreamException

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Tells whether this stream has been closed.

Returns:
true if the stream is closed; false otherwise.

position

long position()
Returns the current position (pointer) in the stream. Immediately after opening this stream, it is 0.

Returns:
the current position in the stream.
